item.title: May 6th: The Cops Election
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
May 6th will mark regional local elections in the UK, to include the London mayoral election. Considering that 4 of the 5 of us are based in London, this does in fact affect us. However, all polling indicates that Sadiq Khan will win again on a platform of More Cops and handing all decisions to property developers, with the remaining candidates all basically wanting More Cops. Sian Berry? Bad. Laurence Fox? Don't make me laugh. Shaun Bailey? Joke. Brian Rose? Okay, he's extremely bad also, but that man is a verifiable content machine. So, we decided on a platform of 'vote if you want to do but don't really expect much either way' and then decided to talk about Brian Rose's completely bonkers life force. Hope you enjoy!

If you want access to our Patreon bonus episodes, early releases of free episodes, and powerful Discord server, sign up here: https://www.patreon.com/trashfuture

We support the London Renters Union, which helps people defeat their slumlords and avoid eviction. If you want to support them as well, you can here: https://londonrentersunion.org/donate

Here's a central location to donate to bail funds across the US to help people held under America's utterly inhumane system: https://bailproject.org/?form=donate

*WEB DESIGN ALERT* Tom Allen is a friend of the show (and the designer behind our website). If you need web design help, reach out to him here:  https://www.tomallen.media/

Trashfuture are: Riley (@raaleh), Milo (@Milo_Edwards), Hussein (@HKesvani), Nate (@inthesedeserts), and Alice (@AliceAvizandum)

item.title: Eating from the Toilet to Own the Libs
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: This was supposed to be a hard-hitting episode with an interview about Russia and leftism in Russian politics, but we had a classic TF season 1 moment when the recording failed. So, here's what we were able to salvage from the episode, with a great review of the recent UK op-ed about feeding yourself slop to trigger the woke left. We love this island, we love the times we live in, and we (unironically) love you.

item.itunes:author: TrashFuture

item.title: American Psychosis | Episode 2: What's Going On (Feat. Dan Boeckner)
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: Andrew and Riley are joined by Dan Boeckner of Operators and The Bottlemen for the second episode of our series about the lasting cultural impact of September 11. We discuss Dan's recollection of the day, the impact that 9/11 had on the playlists of radio stations across the country, artists censoring their own songs, misguided musical output, and the only musician we can think of to create a lasting, prescient response in the form of a memorable concept album.

item.title: The Pragmatic Nut feat. Nish Kumar
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: This week, we've brought on Nish Kumar to once again listen to a horrible 'taut, sexy, political thriller' by a former MP -- this time one by Vince Cable. It sucks really bad but Riley, Milo, Hussein, and Alice had a great time and Nish suffered the English curse yet again.

item.title: Midwestology 1: A Posse, If You Will, of Insane Clowns
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: We've been very happy that you, the fans, have enjoyed Britainology so much. In an attempt to bridge the gap between our two cultures, Nate has brought on two fellow Midwesterners (Francis Horton from Hell of a Way, a native of St. Louis, Missouri; Joe Kassabian from Lions Led by Donkeys, a native of Detroit, Michigan) to flip the script on Milo. Now it's the good-natured Midwestern oafs in the driver's seat, and we explain the name of the region itself, why ICP had such appeal to our generation, and why literally everyone has a driving-while-intoxicated story involving being thrown out of someone's house.

item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
Contrary to popular belief, we were not the people who broke the story about Lex Greensill and supply chain finance -- we just fell in love with it because it was the perfect intersection of all our interests (tech bullshit, obvious fraud, Australians, guys). However, someone who has been on this story since its inception is Financial Times journalist Rob Smith (@BondHack), and he's on the show today to review what's happened in this big ol' mess-er-idoo.

item.title: Waiting for Lordstown feat. Bryan Quinby
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
“We’re bringing the jobs back!” has long been the rallying cry of the right, but what kinds of businesses are actually coming back to places like Lordstown, Ohio? We are joined by Bryan Quinby (@murderxbryan) of Street Fight Radio to do a deep dive on Lordstown Motors - a “too good to be true” electric car manufacturer that has set up shop in the town of the same name. It’s all well and good when rich people take money off one another, but what about the workers who believe their lives are getting back on track?

The primary source for this episode was this report published by short seller Hindenburg Research, which also similarly exposed Nikola. https://hindenburgresearch.com/lordstown/

item.title: Met Police Given “Two Thumbs Up” by Met Police (feat. Leslie Kern)
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
We sat down with Leslie Kern (@LellyK)--feminist geographer, academic, and author of Feminist City: Claiming Space in a Man-Made World--to discuss what it means that "a feminist city is a police free city," in the wake of a slew of misogynistic, racist, and otherwise generally brutal actions attributed to London's finest. First, though, we take a look with some satisfaction at Deliveroo's shoddy IPO performance.

item.title: Magna Carta Landlords: America Version feat. Sam Knight
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
(This is this week's free episode -- we've listened to your requests and are now hosting the free episodes on here as well)

This week, we’re joined by Sam Knight of the District Sentinel (@TheDCSentinel) to discuss a U.S. Supreme Court case that may make it even harder for union organizers to meet with farm labourers in the US. With the exceptionally rational and normal composition of the Court, chances are good that this could make things even worse. We also discuss Prince Harry becoming the chief engagement officer at a mental health startup in the US, because why wouldn’t he.

item.title: Britainology 12: Only Fools and Horses
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: In this episode, Milo takes Nate on the most inscrutable journey yet: a vision of British 1980s/90s sitcoms that are too cockney to be parsed without a translator. Yes, it's the 'Heroes and Villains' episode of Only Fools and Horses, perhaps the most British thing Nate has had to encounter yet, and the one that did the most to break his spirit. Hope you enjoy!

item.title: Britainology 11: Cursed Architecture feat. India Block
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: Why is it that this island in the North Atlantic has such shit buildings? What is the reason for slapping gravel on buildings and calling it an aesthetic? Why did Britain sell off most of it social housing and make it functionally impossible to replace it? All this, and more, explored on yet another Britainology -- this one featuring architecture critic India Block (@indiablock)

item.title: Balthasar Speedboat X feat. Tom Walker and Aidan 'Taco' Jones
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: There's this mysterious land called Terra Australis where the government has taken a slightly different approach to the US and UK, and as a result they have relatively normal life right now. It's the height of summer and they're enjoying their lives, and we managed to get friends of the show Tom Walker and Aidan 'Taco' Jones to discuss a variety of things with us. All riffs, no real point, some laughs (hopefully!)

item.title: Britainology 10: Princess Diana (RIP)
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: It's time once again for Britainology, and this week Milo and Nate are joined by Phoebe Roy (who you have have heard on Masters of Our Domain and 10,000 Posts) to discuss British 9/11. Do we mean 7/7? The 2011 riots? No, we mean the death of the Queen of Our Hearts, Princess Diana Spencer, in August 1997. Never has a nation freaked out more, and we provide the key to understanding it all.

item.title: The Hanseatic Art World feat. Jessica Eaton
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
This week, a nearly complete cast of Riley, Milo, Nate, and Alice speak with Jessica Eaton, a fine art photographer working in Montreal. Why is it that the art world is basically a billionaire tax dodge? Why do certain hedge funds seem to have so much weight in fine art purchases, even if the works are never shown? What the hell is going on? Learn more by listening to this episode.

You can see Jessica's work via the galleries listed on her website here: https://www.jessicaeaton.com

item.title: The Boney Island Whitefish in: The Bones They Are A-Changing
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
This is it. The last straw. The final bone.

Andrew and Riley are here one last time for the final episode of season 5 of Bones. No other season of the show exists as far as we know.  Join us as the writers of Bones basically give up one last time and send Bones to Indonesia, send Booth to Afghanistan and send Angela and Hodgins to fuck in ZZ Top's car.  Thank you for joining us on this strange and perplexing journey into mid 2000s post-9/11 network television.

item.title: Britainology 7: The Falklands War
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: On this festive Britainology we are joined by Alice to discuss the 1982 Falklands War. Why has it permanently lodged in the psyche of the Boomers? Why do people care about these rocks in the middle of the South Atlantic? Why did a British task force commander decide to explode himself in order to dislodge a machine gun position? You will be able to learn all of this and more by listening.

item.title: Tom Watson's House of Pain feat. Nish Kumar
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: How to explain this? Tom Watson--yes, THAT Tom Watson--has written a 'taut, political thriller' about what if Labour and the Tories came together to make sure NHS patient data was sold to pharmaceutical companies in an ethical way. It's deeply boring in a manner that reflects its author, but it's also something else: an experience. Riley read the whole book and forced Nish Kumar to listen to it along with Milo, Hussein, and Alice. Hope you enjoy!

Why is it so horny? Why is everything a double entendre? Is this really the nation that once ruled the waves? You be the judge -- hope you enjoy!

item.title: Red Jawn feat. Well There's Your Problem
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
Quaid... start the podcast and save Mars...

Justin, Liam, and our very own Alice of Well There’s Your Problem Podcast (on Youtube!) are here to discuss Elon Musk's ludicrous plan to put humanity on spaceships with pizza restaurants in them and ship them off to Mars to live in large greenhouses for reasons of... well... Mars. Where else in the solar system are you going to live? Anyway, like most big stupid tech things - it's a fun story to distract you while SpaceX becomes a (sigh) privatiser of public goods through government contracting. Plus ca change.

Mars. Where else in the solar system are you going to live? Anyway, like most big stupid tech things - it's a fun story to distract you while SpaceX becomes a (sigh) privatiser of public goods through government contracting. Plus ca change.

item.title: The Boney Island Whitefish in: Bone in Your Lane for Love
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: It's a spooky, scary Halloween special that Riley and Andrew accidentally recorded pretty close to Halloween! Bones and the gang from the Jeffersonian Medico Institute for Sexual Harassment investigate the mysterious death of a real witch, where they briefly consider whether actual magic may play a part? Plus, a safety feature on the 2009 Toyota Prius leads to an unexpected jailhouse romance in The B Plot.

Bones and the gang from the Jeffersonian Medico Institute for Sexual Harassment investigate the mysterious death of a real witch, where they briefly consider whether actual magic may play a part? Plus, a safety feature on the 2009 Toyota Prius leads to an unexpected jailhouse romance in The B Plot.

item.title: Balthasar Speedboat 7
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: It's been a while, but we've brought it back: our non-stop comedy riff series returns with Riley, Milo, and special guests Glenn Moore and Pierre Novellie. Riley posits the argument that 'The History Boys' is the actual true 20th century British artistic work. We also discuss airport novels and whole lot more. Sorry for the delay!

item.title: The Boney Island Whitefish in: the Ghosts of Rock 'n' Bones
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: It's time to investigate the death of God! Also, there's a Breakfast Update bookended with Dinner Updates. And after all that, we find out that Agent Booth truly loves "rock and roll". But how will the team from the Jeffersonian-Medico Institute for Sexual Harassment solve this mystery with only 42 minutes to spare?

item.title: Politically Hamburgled feat. Beep Beep Lettuce
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: Riley did the unthinkable. The unimaginable. He read Matt Forde's terrible book 'Politically Homeless' for us and described it to an all star cast of Riley, Alice, and special guests Bryn and Chris from the Beep Beep Lettuce podcast (@weedpod). You will love it, but not as much as Matt Forde loves Tony Blair.

item.title: DabKinsey Consulting LLP (ft. LivPosting)
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: Twitch streamer LivPosting returns to talk about her experiences in the job market, and how she almost got a job with a Zoomer-only consulting firm making millions of dollars from teaching Raytheon executives how to say "yeet." Also, is a phone box in rural Winchester the new world epicentre of the BLM movement? According to one brain poisoned conservative columnist, it is! Local hi-jinx abound.

item.title: Britainology 5: The Cult of the Legend
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: We brought on Riley to discuss a phenomenon as eternally British as bad weather itself: the legend. Who are British legends? What makes them act this way? How do you create a taxonomy of figures to distinguish between the Essex Geezer, the Entrepreneurial Legend, the High Street Hard Man, and Tim Westwood? Well, we gave it our best go.

item.title: The Boney Island Whitefish in: Something's Fishy About This Murder
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: It's time for a Breakfast and Dinner update, followed by Condom Chat, the death of the buffet restaurant, embarrassing memories and - eventually - an underwater episode of Bones.
item.description: It's time for a Breakfast and Dinner update, followed by Condom Chat, the death of the buffet restaurant, embarrassing memories and - eventually - an underwater episode of Bones.

item.title: La Femme Nikola feat. Quantian1
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: We did it again. We found an extremely criminal "tech" company -- this time, a notional Tesla competitor that makes trucks. One catch: they don't work! However, to involve the incredible financial chicanery that went into it, we brought on friend of the show Quantian1 (@quantian1) to discuss it with Riley, Milo, Hussein, and Alice.

However, to involve the incredible financial chicanery that went into it, we brought on friend of the show Quantian1 (@quantian1) to discuss it with Riley, Milo, Hussein, and Alice.

item.title: Getting Dilb-pilled (feat. Aisling McCrea)
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
This week, we're talking Dilbert and Scott Adams. Why? Well, for some reason all five of us liked Dilbert as a kid. Also, it just so happens that friend of the show Aisling McCrea (@ambientGillian) just published an article in Current Affairs about Dilbert's strange appeal. So, let's talk about it. Let's talk about Scott Adams' promise that he can make you no-touch cum. Let's dilb out.

Read Aisling's article here!  https://www.currentaffairs.org/2020/10/the-adams-principle/

item.title: On the Sanctity of the Pump feat. Patrick Wyman
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
This week we bring back historian, podcaster, and certified big guy Patrick Wyman (@Patrick_Wyman) to discuss the terrible 2013 Michael Bay film Pain & Gain. What can we learn about America's descent into fascism from this film? As it turns out, a hell of a lot.

Check out Patrick's writing on Discontents here: https://discontents.substack.com

item.title: The Boney Island Whitefish in: Bonesday the Thirteenth
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: Take a trip back to the heady days of the Noughties as Andrew and Riley cover Naked News, Johnny Knoxville, the 2000 Sydney Paralympics scandal, the Grandma's Boy extended universe,  Coors commercial  - and even an episode of Bones.

item.title: Gross Family Values feat. Tom Walker
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: Aw crikey! Australian comedian and Twitch streamer Tom Walker (@tomwalkerisgood) joins the gang to learn all about Gross Family Values. Specifically, how if you’re Bill Gross, one of the world’s most famous bond investors, you’ll react to your acrimonious divorce in 2015 by writing a series of stranger and stranger investment outlooks that focus mainly on how much you hate your imbecilic do-nothing son.

item.title: The Boney Island Whitefish in: The 16th Episode Spooktacular
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: It's the 100th episode of Bones! You know what that means! Something fun? No! It means abandoning the fun parts of the show for a joyless slog of a flashback episode!   LEARN the origins of Booth's carefree spirit! GASP as Bones gets fired in her first day on the FBI job! SCREAM at an extravagant Dinner Update!

item.title: Britainology 4: That '70s Episode
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: We're back again to explain the eccentricities and fault lines of this truly normal island. This week, Milo and Nate discuss the 1970s in Britain, why everything went downhill, why the decade radicalised the Boomers, and why the TV from that era is.... not good. Hope you enjoy!

item.title: The Boney Island Whitefish in: The Case of the Missing A-Plot
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: Bones making people independently wealthy with her book profits! Gratuitous Toyota product placement! Breakfast update! Pretty much forgetting to put a murder in there until the end! It's all in another episode of season 5 of Bones with Andrew and Riley.
item.description: Bones making people independently wealthy with her book profits! Gratuitous Toyota product placement! Breakfast update! Pretty much forgetting to put a murder in there until the end! It's all in another episode of season 5 of Bones with Andrew and Riley.

item.title: Pret Police On My Back
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: The United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland is a country run by and for landlords. However, the coronavirus crisis has created a problem: if people congregate en masse in offices and places of business, the disease spreads and people die! However, mitigating this requires people to not be in offices or grim city centre restaurants. So, what is the British commentator class saying about it? Die for Pret. That's right folks, you need to die for Pret.

That's right folks, you need to die for Pret.

item.title: The Boney Island Whitefish in: Murder in Coptown (Feat. @tomwalkerisgood)
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: The boys are joined by comedian Tom Walker to discover the mystery behind a Satanic murder! The answer lies deep in the heart of Coptown, on the corner of Spooky Boulevard...
item.description: The boys are joined by comedian Tom Walker to discover the mystery behind a Satanic murder! The answer lies deep in the heart of Coptown, on the corner of Spooky Boulevard...

item.title: In Search of (Even More) Racist Facebook
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: Have you heard the story about right-wingers who decide to build their own social media, crowdfunding, or even ridesharing sites? We're talking Gab, Hatreon, and the like. Why do they all fail? Why are they so poorly assembled? And why does this keep happening? The True Chaos Configuration of Riley, Milo, and Alice attempt to decipher this riddle for our times.

Why do they all fail? Why are they so poorly assembled? And why does this keep happening? The True Chaos Configuration of Riley, Milo, and Alice attempt to decipher this riddle for our times.

item.title: Johannes Vonk and the Clogheads Present: Honkbal Hoofdklasse (On My Radio Tonight)
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
Here it is: the song you have all requested. The sound of the summer. The perfect musical accompaniment for standing on the honk.

[breaking out of irony mode for a second] I can't express in words how much I appreciate the positive reception that this has gotten. Milo and I put in some absurdly long hours working on this, mostly because--like anyone else on planet earth who isn't a piece of garbage--we haven't exactly had a great time these past few months and it's been nice to find some sort of an outlet for it. Thank you all so much. -Nate

item.title: Britainology 3: Understanding Home Counties Guys
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: This week's bonus features Milo and Nate on another Britainology, this time with Kent guy Hussein, to discuss the Home Counties and how the deeply cursed world of London suburbia has created an identity of Britishness that you've probably encountered, even if you didn't recognise it. Hope you enjoy!

item.title: The Boney Island Whitefish in: The Mystery of the Mainstream Minorities
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: Get ready to have your assumptions challenged as Bones presents you with the straightest gays and the whitest POCs that 2009 has ever encountered! Booth has a little brother, and their relationship is stupid! This is the humpday of episodes!

item.title: The Duffield-Chiles Complex feat. Juliet Jacques
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: This week we've got Juliet Jacques (@zinovievletter) on to discuss the most cursed relationship in liberal Britain: awful right-wing lib Labour MP Rosie Duffield and her ex-boyfriend, the inscrutable Guardian columnist Adrian Chiles. It's one for the ages, a star-crossed romance, and since this is Britain you can rest assured that transphobia is involved. Hope you enjoy it!

item.title: The Boney Island Whitefish in: The Last Blockbuster On The Left (Feat. Will Menaker)
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
Chest passes! Carefully aimed jump shots! Ball control without hot-dogging! That's right, Chapo Trap House's Will Menaker joins Andrew and Riley for an all-showrunner display of podcasting fundamentals. 

This week the brave technicians at the Jeffersonian-Medico Institute for Sexual Harassment are forced to investigate the cause of death of a very mysterious and influential historical figure! Deep respect for the boots of the American empire is sure to follow. 

We also spring a gotcha Breakfast Update on Will and plan our future endeavours running a Airbnb Blockbuster so that we can lecture teens about Michael Mann films. Enjoy!
item.description:
Chest passes! Carefully aimed jump shots! Ball control without hot-dogging! That's right, Chapo Trap House's Will Menaker joins Andrew and Riley for an all-showrunner display of podcasting fundamentals. 

This week the brave technicians at the Jeffersonian-Medico Institute for Sexual Harassment are forced to investigate the cause of death of a very mysterious and influential historical figure! Deep respect for the boots of the American empire is sure to follow. 

We also spring a gotcha Breakfast Update on Will and plan our future endeavours running a Airbnb Blockbuster so that we can lecture teens about Michael Mann films. Enjoy!

item.title: A Cheeky Coup with the Lads, Part II (feat. Joe Kassabian)
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
This is the follow up to this week's free episode, which is available here: https://trashfuturepodcast.podbean.com/e/a-cheeky-coup-with-the-lads-feat-joe-kassabian/

Why did a steely-eyed SAS veteran Etonian weirdo team up with Margaret Thatcher's son to try and launch a coup in Equatorial Guinea in 2004? Mostly because they were bored. In this episode we discuss the consequences of a dumb plot that was foiled by an errant bird and the Zimbabwean customs office.

item.title: Keanu Reeves Predicted 5G Corona
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
This week, we're in the Super Chaos Configuration: Riley is gone but you have the rest of the cast. Milo, Hussein, Nate, and Alice review the 1995 Robert Longo film JOHNNY MNEMONIC, an adaptation of a William Gibson story that, uh, did not achieve its goals. And yet it's also weirdly accurate in some ways: posting destroys your brain, there's a global pandemic, corporations rule with an iron fist. And yet somehow we haven't yet encountered a cybernetic hacker junkie dolphin. If only.

We make reference to the Fetischpro video from YouTube, which you can see here -- it is definitely not work safe: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FbgJck9kUGc

Here's a central location to donate to bail funds across the US to help people held under America's utterly inhumane system: https://secure.givelively.org/donate/the-bail-project

*WEB DESIGN ALERT* Tom Allen is a friend of the show (and the designer behind GYDS dot com). If you need web design help, reach out to him here:  https://www.tomallen.media/

item.title: Britainology 2: The Noble Football Hooligan
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: This week, Nate and Milo are discussing the 2005 film Green Street Hooligans, in which an American played by Elijah Wood goes to Britain and gets inducted into a football firm, learning a lot about himself along the way. Is it a good movie? No. But does it accurately portray football hooliganism? Also no.

item.title: Fancy Art for Fancy Lads feat. Josie Long
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
Sorry for the delayed release on this. During the recording we were convinced that we'd lost the entire Josie segment, so we recorded a second half that's almost the same length. As such, this is a long one, but I think you'll enjoy. It involves the elitism of the art world, Josie Long's commentary on the way in which the entire world is gatekept by the rich, and the second segment features a guy calling his billionaire friend for advice about the state of the world. The advice, as you might expect, is normal as hell.

item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: We're saddened to inform you that there is no potential supernatural murderer posited in this episode. But we're very happy to inform you that at least 30% of this episode is promotional material for the premiere of the 3D Summer blockbuster James Cameron's Avatar!  We also have an update on Bagelgate, a letter from a listener and our earliest instance of Wild Speculation yet!

But we're very happy to inform you that at least 30% of this episode is promotional material for the premiere of the 3D Summer blockbuster James Cameron's Avatar!  We also have an update on Bagelgate, a letter from a listener and our earliest instance of Wild Speculation yet!

item.title: Britainology Episode 1: A Clump from Dave Courtney
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
Welcome to the inaugural episode of Britainology, in which Milo makes Nate watch something terminally British and then explains it. This week, we're watching a documentary about self-described celebrity gangster Dave Courtney, a crime doorman who thinks he runs Britain.

If you want to watch the original documentary, it's available here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wqARxpCpZU4

Our theme song for this series is from the 'Visit to Primrose Hill Extended Version' of the 1993 Blur song 'For Tomorrow,' which Nate picked because it was formative in teaching him various aspects of London geography and it's premium old millennial / young gen xer nostalgia bait. You can listen to it on Spotify here: https://open.spotify.com/track/3mvdN3a4p4SaOnpUBGWan2?si=B8IQ7g1PSfGqFw_P1dSY9Q

item.title: Balthasar Speedboat 69 feat. Caroline Calloway
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: Was it a good idea? Probably not. But we've assembled the Balthasar Speedboat cast of Riley, Milo, Olga, and Pierre for a friendly conversation with chaos demon and influencer Caroline Calloway...who Milo knows from school...and you know what? Just listen to the episode to hear him get eviscerated for his acne and an awkward attempt at a kiss. You'll love it! Or you'll hate it.

item.title: The Boney Island Whitefish in: Bring Your Grandpa To Work Day
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
Riley and Andrew are back to discuss the collapse of late-2000s network television during the rise of streaming, the provincial local media of Australia and the UK, competing bagel franchises, horny grandpas in fetish clubs and spontaneous human combustion. 

All in a day's work for the internet's only podcast about season 5 of American crime procedural comedy-drama television series Bones.

item.title: The TF Union Presents: The St. Brendan's Day Debate
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
It's O'Neill versus O'Neill... versus O'Neill versus O'Neill versus O'Neill versus O'Neill. It's a six-way Brendan O'Neill battle moderated by the only man who could possibly moderate a clash of intellectual titans like this: Brendan O'Neill. It may sound like @inthesedeserts, @raaleh, @Hkesvani, @AliceAvizandum, @milo_edwards, @rocknrolga, and our friend Phoebe Roy (@10kpostspod), but we must insist it is all Brendan O'Neill.

They are debating the motion: THB the chattering classes of this once great nation are at it again.

item.title: The Boney Island Whitefish in: The Suspiciously Scarce Super Soldiers
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
Riley and Andrew have swum gently upstream to once again bring you an episode of the Boney Island Whitefish.

What if this murder victim was a DARPA-created hybrid human-avian killing machine? They almost definitely aren't, but imagine if they were! These are the important things that the writers of this episode of Bones want you to very briefly consider, before forgetting about that plotline. Will Angela break her volcel commitment? Does workplace exposure to sulphites change the shape of your skull? Will the murderer have a motive that isn't revealed in the last 2 minutes of the show? Find out the answers in this week's Boney Island Whitefish!

item.title: Smart Bins, Smart City feat. Jathan Sadowski
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
In the logical follow-up to our previous episode about 'smart cities,' we've brought on author and researcher Jathan Sadowski (@jathansadowski) to discuss what happened with Google's plan for self-adjusting sidewalks and cities with sideways elevators. You'll love it!

If you want to read more from Jathan, check out his book 'TOO SMART: How Digital Capitalism is Extracting Data, Controlling Our Lives, and Taking Over the World' from MIT Press here: https://mitpress.mit.edu/books/too-smart

item.title: Norf FC (Ultra Section) feat. Robyn Vinter
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
We talked to Robyn Vinter of the Overtake about Culture War - what actually is it, what purpose does it serve, and why won't it end? The answer is "spite," but how we get there is more interesting. We also read an article by one of our favourite journalists on why his mission to Own The Libs may result in him losing a foot to diabetes, which is kind of like WWII when you think about it.

item.title: Frankenstein's Balance Sheet
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: There's a ticking time bomb in the economy. No, a DIFFERENT ticking time bomb. This week, Riley, Milo, Hussein, and Alice discuss the balance-sheet chicanery of a mysterious Australian plane enthusiast that is slowly but surely imploding every SoftBank investment vehicle. We would normally say it's a laugh riot, but this one... maybe not so much.

item.title: The Boney Island Whitefish in: Cult Murder on the Secret Stealth Submarine
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
Hey! This patron-exclusive Boonta Vista/Trashfuture collaboration is the first episode of an extremely specific podcast-within-a-podcast in which Andrew and Riley recap episodes of season 5 of the American crime procedural comedy-drama Bones. 

In this episode we explain the origins of Bones, why season 5 of Bones is worth examination, and the season premiere which includes Psychic Cyndi Lauper, Poopie Suits, brain surgery-induced coma hallucinations, underwater cults, fake diseases, clowns and much more.

item.title: Microsoft Rocks feat. Rob Larson
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
This week we're talking tech monopolies and the ways in which Gates and Bezos used public research to become this century's dumber Carnegie and Vanderbilt. Listen to Riley, Milo, and Alice discuss it with Rob Larson (@IronicProfessor), and rejoice in the knowledge that everything you've ever done with a PC was planned out by dudes in rocking chairs for some reason.

Check out Rob's Book Capitalism vs. Freedom: the Toll Road to Serfdom, out from Zer0 Books. Get it here: https://www.johnhuntpublishing.com/zer0-books/our-books/capitalism-freedom

*WEB DESIGN ALERT* Tom Allen is a friend of the show (and the designer behind GYDS dot com). If you need web design help, reach out to him here:  https://www.tomallen.media/

item.title: Intelligence 4.0 (ft. Felix Biederman)
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: Riley, Alice, Milo, and Chapo Trap House's Felix Biederman have once again sat down and cracked open a book of brain literature. This time we read through British brain god Dr. Matt Ridley's The Rational Optimist (2010), and it left us all a lot happier as we explored a truly beautiful mind. It's a balm for the soul. Check it out!

item.title: Riley's Commie Night Club (ft. Nathalie Olah, Jesse Bernard, and Tom Usher)
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
Riley's Commie Book Club is (sort of) back... but a little different. Instead of talking about a book, Riley is joined by some old friends and new to talk about nightlife - what is nightlife, why is it important, and what are the economic and social factors that threaten the continued existence of "nightlife" as something valuable? Or maybe the four of us are on the wrong end of 25 and assuming it's all bad now.

Also, this was recorded before the end of the world - so many of the pressures facing nightlife have uhhh changed, but they aren't going anywhere! Anyway, maybe this is hauntology now. We'll be doing a normal "Riley reads a book episode" again soon, though!

item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
We did it again. Joined once more by Séamus Malekafzali (@seamus_malek), we reviewed a terrible Hollywood take on America's imperial reach. Another CIA movie. Another movie about empire, except this time it's about a horny congressman who manages to give Al Qaeda a billion dollars.  If you want one of our *fine* new shirts, designed by Matt Lubchansky, then e-mail trashfuturepodcast [at] gmail [dot] com. £15 for patrons, £20 for non-patrons, plus shipping.

item.title: A Spectre Haunting Bishop Auckland (TF Live in Bristol 6.3.20 feat. Angie Speaks)
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: Please enjoy this live episode of Trashfuture, recorded on March 6 the 2020 Bristol Transformed festival. You’ll hear Riley (@raaleh), Milo (@Milo_Edwards), Hussein (@HKesvani), and Nate (@inthesedeserts) join special guest Angie Speaks (@speaksangie) to discuss an app that retroactively places products in existing films -- who hasn’t wanted to get ads for Casper Mattresses when watching 1970s noir films -- and a long story about a man who wants to remake Bishop Auckland in his own, uh, slightly vampiric image.

item.title: The Story of Oh No feat. Andrew Law
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: Riley's found some deeply, deeply horny British political writing, and in an attempt to shatter the psychic resolve of our friends down under, he's brought on Andrew Law (@illybocean) of the Boonta Vista podcast. This is also the 10th official TF episode as it features founding cohosts Charlie Palmer and Olga Koch. Hope you enjoy!

item.title: Anarchy, State, and Scrutopia feat. Nathan Oseroff-Spicer
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
You've all heard the various encomiums about Roger fucking Scruton, the absurdly racist idiot philosopher who was terrified of the female orgasm and was somehow welcomed in every echelon of the British state for decades. Well, we've brought on an academic philosopher and friend of the show Nathan Oseroff-Spicer (@nathanoseroff) to break down Scruton's work in detail. And guess what? It's... interesting.

item.title: Indiana uber Alles feat. Matt Lubchansky
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
Did you hear about the app that wants to 3D model your face to make sure you're a girl? It's called Giggle and we do not approve of it. In this episode Riley, Hussein, Alice, and artist Matt Lubchansky (@lubchansky) also discuss Mayor Pete, the US democratic primary, and much more. We thought about calling this episode 'ISIS for Girls' but Alice got to choose the title after she completely evaporated Riley's brain by reading test copy from Pete Buttigieg's website. Don't worry -- we recorded it all.

If you want to support Matt's cartooning, sign up at The Nib and receive the incredible content that they produce! Get that here: https://membership.thenib.com

Did you hear about the app that wants to 3D model your face to make sure you're a girl? It's called Giggle and we do not approve of it. In this episode Riley, Hussein, Alice, and artist Matt Lubchansky (@lubchansky) also discuss Mayor Pete, the US democratic primary, and much more. We thought about calling this episode 'ISIS for Girls' but Alice got to choose the title after she completely evaporated Riley's brain by reading test copy from Pete Buttigieg's website. Don't worry -- we recorded it all.

If you want to support Matt's cartooning, sign up at The Nib and receive the incredible content that they produce! Get that here: https://membership.thenib.com

item.title: World of Moggcraft feat. Nish Kumar
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: This week, we're talking Jacob Rees-Mogg's history: his book 'The Victorians' might be the single worst collection of words that Riley's ever subjected himself to (so far), and we've brought on friend of the show Nish Kumar (@mrnishkumar) to discuss it. You might even call it a 'Horrible History,' but that would be anti-British drivel!

You might even call it a 'Horrible History,' but that would be anti-British drivel!

item.title: Riley's Commie Book Club: Riding for Deliveroo (ft Callum Cant)
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
It's the (belated) January edition of Riley's Commie Book Club! Riley spoke with author, academic, and labour activist Callum Cant on his book Riding for Deliveroo: Resistance in the New Economy. We get into algorithmic management, the insipid patronising internal PR of tech companies, what it's really like to ride for Deliveroo, and the new forms of solidarity emerging from precarious work.

Buy Callum's book! Here's a link: https://housmans.com/product/riding-for-deliveroo/

*WEB DESIGN ALERT* Tom Allen is a friend of the show (and the designer behind GYDS.com). If you need web design help, reach out to him here:  https://www.tomallen.media/ 

*COME SEE MILO*If you want to catch Milo’s stand-up on tour, get tickets here: https://linktr.ee/miloontour 

*LAST TICKETS ALERT* As this is posted, there are only *six tickers remaining* for our live show debate on the topic of Elon Musk's status as 21st century Willy Wonka. It's 6th Feb 7.30pm at Hen & Chickens Theatre (109 St Paul’s Road, London N1 2NA) -- tickets are £12.25 and you can get them here:   https://www.unrestrictedview.co.uk/trashfuture-live-the-comedy-debate/ 

If you can't make it in, then tune in online, at twitch.tv/trashfuturepodcast

9 Likes

item.title: This Episode Brought To You By The Letter B feat. Soweto Kinch
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
And on the pedestal, these words appear: 'bung a bob for Big Ben to bong for Brexit.' This accursed phrase has melted our brains, and you get to hear it happen in real time on this episode. It's a mass gathering of Riley, Milo, Nate, Alice, Olga, and special guest Soweto Kinch (@sowetokinch), and things get weird. We hope you'll love this episode as much as we hate being alive after reading the material that went in to it.

Check out Soweto's most recent album, 'The Black Peril', here: https://www.musicglue.com/soweto-kinch/products/the-black-peril

Check out Olga's tour here: https://www.rocknrolga.com

Also please check out Milo's tour dates, to include Saturday, 18 January in London: https://linktr.ee/miloontour

item.title: I Am the Very Model of the Modern Persian General
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: It's the chaos configuration of Riley, Milo, and Alice on this week's bonus episode (Nate and Hussein were busy being boring lames). We're talking about the assassination of Qassem Soleimani and the tragic hilariousness of America's constant self-sabotage when it tries to do imperialism. Guess what: it's not good, folks!

item.title: My British Values are Tea/Racism feat. Devon
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: This week, we’re reviewing a startup called WhiteHat, digesting a terrible Giles Coren wankfest about Oxford admissions, and—most importantly—speaking to friend of the show and biology teacher Devon (@Devon_OnEarth) about the state-mandated ‘British Values’ education. Spoiler alert: it’s inchoate and weird!

item.title: Takfir and Loathing: TF Reviews 'Body of Lies' (2008)
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: Look, maybe we just needed a break. Maybe there's nothing particularly good to talk about politically in this moment of elected dictatorship. However, we can talk about trash culture and the cult of super-smart drones, and as such we've reviewed the 2008 Ridley Scott film 'Body of Lies,' which is bad. Why does Leo DiCaprio dress like a podcaster? Why are there basically zero Arab actors in major roles in this film? Why is Russell Crowe such a weird Foghorn Leghorn ass guy? Listen to hear our takes on this, and much more.

Listen to hear our takes on this, and much more.

item.title: Commission Impossible feat. David Alder
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: This week, we speak to David Adler of DiEM25 about what Remain and Revolt would actually mean -- and why the EU's labyrinthine politics is intentionally boring. We also discuss some great pre-election post-mortem columns, a thing that makes sense. You'll love it!

item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
This week's bonus episode features us discussing the Tory manifesto with John Duncan (@Johntheduncan) on the topic of neoliberalism, the neoliberal weaponisation of rights, and the absurd Tory manifesto. Hope you enjoy!

John's YouTube channel is available here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8g2Ku4i7l6A&feature=youtu.be

*Do some canvassing* Momentum (@peoplesmomentum) has a great resource that lets you sign up to canvassing events in marginal seats close to you. Access it here: https://www.mycampaignmap.com

The only way we can win is by meeting voters face-to-face, so let's make it happen.

*LIVE SHOW ALERT* Come see us live on December 3 at Vauxhall Comedy with special guest Rob Delaney! The address is: 6 South Lambeth Place, London, SW8 1SP, and the show starts at 8:30 pm, doors at 7:00 PM. Tickets are available here: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/trashfuture-live-pre-election-christmas-spectacular-tickets-82622465017?fbclid=IwAR0qE8wwGZAYXWLRiQ_f2yO9urbKS1d-0dUuyE-mWAq6DoGQwAGuNRa_IYw

item.title: The Aristocrats! feat. Loki Nash
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: [Sorry for the late release!] This week, Riley, Milo, Alice, and Nate speak with famed detective Loki Nash (@lokinash06) about his experience being the go-to consultant on BBC radio for what is and is not shitposting. We also discuss a Lib Dem PPC who got sacked for being racist in the early 2010s, the recent Prince Andrew interview, and much more. Hope you enjoy!
item.description: [Sorry for the late release!] This week, Riley, Milo, Alice, and Nate speak with famed detective Loki Nash (@lokinash06) about his experience being the go-to consultant on BBC radio for what is and is not shitposting. We also discuss a Lib Dem PPC who got sacked for being racist in the early 2010s, the recent Prince Andrew interview, and much more. Hope you enjoy!

item.title: Now You're Cooking with Vibes feat. Nathalie Olah
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
You wake up. You turn on your computer to do Fiverr jobs until breakfast. You go to your job. Your contract is secure for another two weeks. You buy lunch for a tenner because you can't go on. You come home, exhausted. It's time for your next job. And you have to pay seven kinds of bills. You've become a burned out husk of a person. But now there's an exciting new venture capital backed startup called Pattern that wants to change all that with luxury cookware somehow. Riley, Milo, Alice, and special guest Nathalie Olah go deep on this strange new theory of change, and why maybe more start ups aren't the answer?

Register to vote! https://www.gov.uk/register-to-vote

Get campaigning! https://www.mycampaignmap.com/

We cannot stress enough how much this matters.

item.title: Riley's Commie Book Club: 'Designing Freedom'
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
It's that time again! Riley's Commie Book Club is back a brief hiatus. This month, we're discussing Stafford Beer's lecture series "Designing Freedom." Beer, one of the principal architects of Cybersyn, the information network that served as the nerve centre for Allende's Chile, spent his life thinking of ways that people could organise to solve common problems in ways that do not create pointless hierarchies between them. Check it out!

I reference an episode of the podcast 99% Invisible here, and I promise I would link it. So! That episode: here.

item.title: Brexit Disco: A Cardiac Event
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: This week’s episode features the full cast of Riley, Milo, Hussein, Nate, and Alice on the topic of three distinctly horrible things: a startup that promises to create its own Chuck E. Cheese tokens instead of paying its workers; Amazon killing people in its fulfillment centres and deciding that actually, this is fine; and the truly most yer da thing in existence, a ‘satirical’ Brexit disco album that’s truly on the outer limits of bad. You’ll love it!

item.title: Young Men’s Fancy: TF Live from the Edinburgh Fringe 10.8.19
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
We did it. We drove from London to Edinburgh with all our equipment in tow, climbed a fucking medieval staircase in a downpour, got soaked to the damn bones, and then played a (sold out!!!!) show at the Edinburgh Fringe. We only had a 50 minute time slot, so this was a short one. Thank you so much to all the fans who came out in the garbage weather to see it.

 *COME SEE MILO* If you're in Edinburgh for the Fringe, come see our boy perform his show
-- it's at 2 pm every day until 26 August: https://tickets.edfringe.com/whats-on/pindos

item.title: A Fulfilment Driven Life feat. Juliet Jacques
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
You wanted to hear more Quillette close-reads, so here it is. We discuss the most bootlicking of all pro-Amazon pieces to ever appear, plus a bizarre 2006 op-ed about shoes from Rafael Behr. Our special guest Juliet Jacques (@zinovievletter) helps us break down just how brain-melt it all is. You'll love it, folks—you'll absolutely love it. 

*COME SEE MILO*If you're in Edinburgh for the Fringe, come see our boy perform his show: https://tickets.edfringe.com/whats-on/pindos

*LIVE SHOW ALERT* We’ll be performing at the Birmingham Transformed festival on 8th August. Details to come in the next few weeks. If you’re in the West Midlands, come down to Brum for a night of delightful soup jokes. Get tickets here! https://ti.to/birmingham-transformed/birmingham-transformed-2019

*OTHER LIVE SHOW ALERT* Come see Trashfuture live at the Edinburgh Fringe! We’ll perform on August 10th at 21.30. The venue is Venue 277, PQA Venues @Riddle's Court, Edinburgh EH1 2PG. Tickets are £11.50 and there are a ton of discounts available. Get them here: https://tickets.edfringe.com/whats-on/trashfuture-live-at-the-fringe

*SPECIAL ANNOUNCEMENT*Guess who’s going to play live at The World Transformed in Brighton this September? That’s right, your favourite podcast lads. Buy a ticket here: http://theworldtransformed.org

item.title: Riley's Commie Book Club - Blindsight
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
It's Commie Book Club's new home! This month, Riley changes gears a little bit from the theoretical to discuss one of his favourite works of Science Fiction, Blindsight by Peter Watts. It's a hard-sci fi first contact novel that is so hard it has citations. Only very minor spoilers contained herein - you are encouraged to read it!

Find it on Watts' website, where he posted it free on his website after a dispute with his publisher.

Different format options available at the top https://rifters.com/real/Blindsight.htm

item.title: Horseplay feat. Nathan Ma
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
Did you know that Riley's hometown newspaper is run by horse people? Did you know that there's a Code Pink-style group that stalks people who work at the Seattle Zoo's elephant enclosure? Did you know that Fiverr wants to drive down your wages but also want to make you feel empowered? Did you know that the Telegraph has found a way to get mad about black people in Bond films? Yes. It's all true. Enjoy this bonus episode with freelance writer and editor Nathan Ma (@nthnashma), and rejoice in the smartness of this world. 

 *LIVE SHOW ALERT* We’ll be performing at the Birmingham Transformed festival on 8th August. Details to come in the next few weeks. If you’re in the West Midlands, come down to Brum for a night of delightful soup jokes. Get tickets here! https://ti.to/birmingham-transformed/birmingham-transformed-2019

*OTHER LIVE SHOW ALERT* Come see Trashfuture live at the Edinburgh Fringe! We’ll perform on August 10th at 21.30. The venue is Venue 277, PQA Venues @Riddle's Court, Edinburgh EH1 2PG. Tickets are £11.50 and there are a ton of discounts available. Get them here: https://tickets.edfringe.com/whats-on/trashfuture-live-at-the-fringe

*SPECIAL ANNOUNCEMENT* Guess who’s going to play live at The World Transformed in Brighton this September? That’s right, your favourite podcast lads. Buy a ticket here: http://theworldtransformed.org

If you want to buy one of our recent special-edition phone-cops shirt, shoot us an email at trashfuturepodcast[at]gmail[dot]com and we can post it to you. (£20 for non-patrons, £15 for patrons)

item.itunes:summary: Riley's cousin lives in London and got the absolute worst tinder-date breakup message. It was so bad, so painfully long-form and weird, that we had to convene a session of Balthasar Speedboat to discuss it. item.title: The ID Card of Dorian Gray
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
Tony Blair, what a guy! Am I right, folks? He can't stop whining about how we need fewer houses and more apps. He can't stop pointing a finger at the Labour party and saying that it was better when we were pro-privatisation and pro-bombing. And now, of course, his institute has a great plan -- a policy paper full of nothing but management consultant speak -- with one sole defined policy goal: national ID cards. Yes, he still wants them. Enjoy this dang podcast!

*LIVE SHOW ALERT* We’ll be performing at the Birmingham Transformed festival on 8th August. Details to come in the next few weeks. If you’re in the West Midlands, come down to Brum for a night of delightful soup jokes. Get tickets here! https://ti.to/birmingham-transformed/birmingham-transformed-2019

item.title: Riley's Commie Book Club - Imagined Communities
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
It’s that time again! This month Riley is reading Benedict Anderson’s graduate seminar standby Imagined Communities. The “nation” is a concept much beloved of reactionaries and dismissed by Marxists as mere ideology. But it has serious psychological power nevertheless. Anderson’s book asks what is a “nation,” where did it come from, and how has the concept been used and misused over time? Riley then applies Anderson’s rubric to understanding the swell of white nationalism that has erupted in the West since the end of the Cold War.

*WATCH THIS SPACE* We’ll be performing at the Birmingham Transformed festival on 8th August. Details to come in the next few weeks. If you’re in the West Midlands, come down to Brum for a night of delightful soup jokes.

*LIVE SHOW ALERT* Come see Trashfuture live at the Edinburgh Fringe! We’ll perform on August 10th at 21.30. The venue is Venue 277, PQA Venues @Riddle's Court, Edinburgh EH1 2PG. Tickets are £11.50 and there are a ton of discounts available. Get them here: https://tickets.edfringe.com/whats-on/trashfuture-live-at-the-fringe

If you want to buy one of our recent special-edition phone-cops shirt, shoot us an email at trashfuturepodcast[at]gmail[dot]com and we can post it to you. (£20 for non-patrons, £15 for patrons)

Do you want a mug to hold your soup? Perhaps you want one with the Trashfuture logo, which is available here: https://teespring.com/what-if-phone-cops#pid=659&cid=102968&sid=front

The “nation” is a concept much beloved of reactionaries and dismissed by Marxists as mere ideology. But it has serious psychological power nevertheless. Anderson’s book asks what is a “nation,” where did it come from, and how has the concept been used and misused over time? Riley then applies Anderson’s rubric to understanding the swell of white nationalism that has erupted in the West since the end of the Cold War.

*WATCH THIS SPACE* We’ll be performing at the Birmingham Transformed festival on 8th August. Details to come in the next few weeks. If you’re in the West Midlands, come down to Brum for a night of delightful soup jokes.

*LIVE SHOW ALERT* Come see Trashfuture live at the Edinburgh Fringe! We’ll perform on August 10th at 21.30. The venue is Venue 277, PQA Venues @Riddle's Court, Edinburgh EH1 2PG. Tickets are £11.50 and there are a ton of discounts available. Get them here: https://tickets.edfringe.com/whats-on/trashfuture-live-at-the-fringe

If you want to buy one of our recent special-edition phone-cops shirt, shoot us an email at trashfuturepodcast[at]gmail[dot]com and we can post it to you. (£20 for non-patrons, £15 for patrons)

item.title: Getting your Nation Serviced feat. Zoe Gardner
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
The UK can't get enough of border forces. We want to fund them in our own country and in other countries, even when those countries want visa-free regional travel. We love making everyone a cop, and we're joined this week by Zoe Gardner (@ZoeJardiniere) from Joint Council for the Welfare of Immigrants (@JCWI_UK) to discuss this.

However, we also have a terrible startup to review, and a great (by which we mean insane) article about why National Service would be a good thing. It's bad, folks!

item.title: Islamic Republic of Seinfeld feat. Sina Rahmani
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
America desperately wants to go to war with Iran, so much that it's willing to engineer some extremely fake circumstances under which it can claim to be the victim of aggression. Why is that? Well, according to Bret Stephens, it's because they hate Ben Franklin, or something. To discuss this, we bring on Sina Rahmani, host of the The East is a Podcast, and ask him why the US can't seem to stop broadcasting its war horniness.

item.title: Riley's Commie Book Club - Marxism and the Philosophy of Science: A Critical History
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
Another instalment of Riley's Commie Book Club delivered to you, our delightful and beloved patrons. This month, Riley decided to take it in a bit of a different direction, and talk about an under-discussed field of study, Marxism and the Philosophy of Science. How should we think about knowledge, what is knowable, and how these questions are related to history and power? To get to these questions, he reads from Helena Sheehan's Marxism and the Philosophy of Science: A Critical History.

The focus of the book is on charting Marxist approaches to the philosophy of science from Engels to the mid 20th century, and while this is interesting, Riley focuses more on the underlying concepts. He absolutely encourages you to look into the book and the actual history it tells, though! It's linked here: https://www.versobooks.com/books/2565-marxism-and-the-philosophy-of-science

Also, check out our live show in London on May 30th: https://www.tickettext.co.uk/trashfuture-podcast/trashfuture-live-30052019/

item.title: President Jake Paul's Heated Moments feat. Chris Stokel-Walker
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
Everyone knows YouTube: the place where you can watch Peppa Pig get beheaded, watch crocodiles turn into chickens, learn about why earth is flat, and so much more. However, YouTube as a cultural phenomenon has created an entire new generation of public figures — a bunch of damn celebrities — and this week Hussein, Milo, and Nate speak with author Chris Stokel-Walker (@stokel) about his new book "YouTubers: How YouTube shook up TV and created a new generation of stars."

You can buy the book here: https://www.canburypress.com/store/p28/-YouTubers-book-by-Chris-Stokel-Walker.html

Also, this episode features a preview of a crossover feature on Nate's podcast What a Hell of a  Way to Die: Riley and Nate discuss Warhammer 40k and why it has such cachet among weird internet reactionaries. Get it on SoundCloud here: https://soundcloud.com/hellofawaytodie/demon-guitar-solo-trumpism-feat-riley-quinn

item.title: Trashfuture Presents: Balthasar Speedboat 4
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: It was a special kind of Sunday morning in London, and the whole gang gathered to record yet another episode of our comedy special Balthasar Speedboat. This round features Riley, Milo, Nate, Olga, Alex Kealy, and Pierre Novellie--and covers important topics like: what if the Hubble telescope saw God's pussy? What happens when the bullied becomes the bully? What is a samovar? And why is it that kids always find something to rip on you about? Hope you enjoy.

item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
This week, Riley, Milo, and Hussein speak with writer Karen Geier (@karengeier) about Butt-mentum—the sudden ubiquity of Pete Buttigieg—as well as other topics to include the Extinction Rebellion protests and an *insane* denunciation of Heathrow Airport by a man writing for Conservative Woman. It's good, folks.

item.title: TF Live at Bristol Transformed feat. Jack Frayne-Reid and Dalia Gebrial
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: This is it, folks. The first live recording with our mobile space station, the first outside-London show, and the first leftist UK politics supergroup podcast featuring Dalia Gebrial of Novara Media and Jack Frayne-Reid of Reel Politik Podcast. Recorded live at Hamilton House, Stokes Croft, Bristol on April 5, 2019, it's a show about the things that matter: brain scanning helmets that write musical symphonies, Bristol's slave-trade past, its devotion to one particular slave-trading city father, and the local Illuminati that worship him like a god.

item.title: Big Bang Gamergate Theory feat. Eleanor Penny
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
Americans love the Big Bang Theory, even if they think they're above it (when we watched an episode in studio, Nate couldn't keep himself from laughing). But why is it so oblivious to the horrors of true nerd culture? Because as special guest Eleanor Penny (@eleanorkpenny) points out, there's already an insanely misogynist show lurking under its adorkable exterior.

In addition, we also discuss Suella Braverman MP's recent use of the term 'Cultural Marxism,' and its origins in Nazi ideology.

If you want to attend Eleanor's debate at the Cambridge Literary Festival, you can get tickets here: http://www.cambridgeliteraryfestival.com/whatson/new-statesman-debate/

*LIVE SHOW ALERT* We'll be performing live at Bristol Transformed on Friday, April 5th at 8 pm. The venue is Hamilton House 3A, 80 Stokes Croft, Bristol BS1 3QY. https://www.facebook.com/events/814946762200366/ View the Facebook event page here: https://www.facebook.com/events/814946762200366/

*COMEDY KLAXON*: On April 10 at The Sekforde (34 Sekforde Street London EC1R 0HA), two of the most profoundly funny voices in British comedy (and members of the Balthasar Speedboat cast), Pierre Novellie and Alex Kealy, will perform at Smoke Comedy. The show starts at 8 pm; tickets are £5 and can be purchased here: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/smoke-comedy-featuring-pierre-novellie-and-alex-kealy-tickets-58849486398?aff=erelexpmlt

In addition, we also discuss Suella Braverman MP's recent use of the term 'Cultural Marxism,' and its origins in Nazi ideology.

If you want to attend Eleanor's debate at the Cambridge Literary Festival, you can get tickets here: http://www.cambridgeliteraryfestival.com/whatson/new-statesman-debate/

*LIVE SHOW ALERT* We'll be performing live at Bristol Transformed on Friday, April 5th at 8 pm. The venue is Hamilton House 3A, 80 Stokes Croft, Bristol BS1 3QY. https://www.facebook.com/events/814946762200366/ View the Facebook event page here: https://www.facebook.com/events/814946762200366/

*COMEDY KLAXON*: On April 10 at The Sekforde (34 Sekforde Street London EC1R 0HA), two of the most profoundly funny voices in British comedy (and members of the Balthasar Speedboat cast), Pierre Novellie and Alex Kealy, will perform at Smoke Comedy. The show starts at 8 pm; tickets are £5 and can be purchased here: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/smoke-comedy-featuring-pierre-novellie-and-alex-kealy-tickets-58849486398?aff=erelexpmlt

item.title: Titania McGrath Tells You You're Smart [ASMR] feat. Dalia Gebrial
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
Amazing how Titania McGrath, a fictional account that owns Millennials by making dad jokes, is the talk of the London Media. It's almost like the account is run by two middle-aged Tories whose friends all RT them out of a sense of obligation. This week, Riley, Milo, and Nate speak with Novara Media's Dalia Gebrial ( @daliagebrial ) about the Titania McGrath 'phenomenon,' and why it speaks to the deeply conservative cornerstones of horniness and hurt feelings.

*COMEDY KLAXON*: On April 10 at The Sekforde (34 Sekforde Street London EC1R 0HA), two of the most profoundly funny voices in British comedy (and members of the Balthasar Speedboat cast), Pierre Novellie and Alex Kealy, will perform at Smoke Comedy. The show starts at 8 pm; tickets are £5 and can be purchased here: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/smoke-comedy-featuring-pierre-novellie-and-alex-kealy-tickets-58849486398?aff=erelexpmlt

item.title: Riley's Commie Book Club: Mark Fisher
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: It’s that time again: Riley sat down with a book, and now you have to hear him talk about it for an hour or so. This month, Riley read K-Punk, out now on Repeater Books. K-Punk collects the previously unpublished writing of British left cultural, political, and social critic Mark Fisher, who explored realism and imagination, future and memory, and the freedom to imagine better worlds.

item.title: Trashfuture Presents: Balthasar Speedboat 3
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: We're back in the saddle for yet another edition of Balthasar Speedboat. This episode features Riley, Milo, Nate, Alex Kealy, Olga Koch, and Pierre Novellie -- and covers the usual spectrum of topics (but mostly Michael Jackson). Did you know Riley apparently sheds hair as a defensive mechanism? Did you know that Richard Nixon was convinced that gays brought down the Roman Empire? All this can be yours, and more.

item.title: A Home in the Polycule feat. Jonn Elledge
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
We did it. We got Jonn Elledge  @JonnElledge  and Alice Caldwell-Kelly ( @AliceAvizandum) on the same podcast to discuss the UK's housing shortage, dorm-style accommodations being packaged as 'solutions,' some polycule chat, and a new VC-backed attempt to undercut Transport for London (and steal your data). This is a good one folks, hope you enjoy it.

item.title: We Need to Talk About Bill (Live 21.2.19 at the Star of Kings, London)
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
When was the last time you looked at Bill Gates, a man who had bangs well into his forties, and said, 'He's got the solution to our problems'? Well, as it just so happens, there are clearly enough Bill-lievers to necessitate an annual philanthropy fanzine, which we managed to get a hold of.

Recorded live at the Star of Kings, this episode features friend of the show and founding member Charlie Palmer, a strung-together sound system, the errant noises of Nate crouching behind the DJ booth to eat a burger, and much more.

Thank you so much to all the real heads who came out to see us live!

*COMEDY KLAXON*: On March 13 at 8pm, Milo will host another Smoke Comedy at the Sekforde (34 Sekforde Street London EC1R 0HA). This show costs £5 and will feature all new material from Tania Edwards, Chloe Petts, Dimitri Bakanov, and Raph Wakefield. Get tickets here: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/smoke-comedy-with-tania-edwards-tickets-56285827425

item.title: Hostile Environment for Flip Phones feat. Victor Patrascan
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
Does it surprise anyone that the Tories would decide that the issue of EU citizens in the UK could be solved with an app? And does it surprise anyone that that app doesn't work? In this week's bonus episode, comedian Victor Patrascan — recently of Romania — joins the Trashfuture crew to discuss the Samsung-only immigration policy. We also discuss a very dumb article about Vene-freaking-zuela.

This episode features a TF first: reporting segments that Hussein and Nate conducted —featuring Maria Llorente from the EU citizens' advocacy group The 3 Million, and with Chicago-based app developer Ryan Jones — because guess what, folks? We've invented the news.

*LIVE SHOW ALERT* We have an upcoming live show -- with comedian Josie Long -- in London on February 21st at the Star of Kings (126 York Way, Kings Cross, London N1 0AX) starting at 7.30 pm. You can buy tickets here: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/trashfuture-live-ft-josie-long-tickets-54546538164

*COMEDY KLAXON* On 27th February at 8 pm, Elf Lyons and a number of other comics will perform at Smoke Comedy at the Sekforde (34 Sekforde Street London EC1R 0HA). Tickets are £5, and you can get them here: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/smoke-comedy-with-elf-lyons-tickets-55825778406

Also: you can commodify your dissent with a t-shirt from http://www.lilcomrade.com/, and what’s more, it’s mandatory if you want to be taken seriously.

Do you want a mug to hold your soup? Perhaps you want one with the Trashfuture logo, which is available here: https://teespring.com/what-if-phone-cops#pid=659&cid=102968&sid=front

item.title: Into The Brexit Mind Palace feat. George Eaton
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
On this week's bonus episode, we're taking you to a brain expansion dimension that you've never visited before. Riley, Hussein, Milo, and Alice join special guest George Eaton, deputy editor at the New Statesman for a discussion of the HBO / Channel 4 feature film 'Brexit' starring Benedict Cumberbatch as Dominic Cummings.

Sure, it's bad, but is that really so surprising? We delve into it with the keen insights that you've come to expect from us.

item.title: The Blurst Is Yet to Come feat. Peter Fleming
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
In this week's bonus, Riley's Commie Book Club is a bit different. This time, Riley speaks with scholar and author Peter Fleming — you might recognize the name from a previous episode discussing his book 'The Death of Homo Economicus' — and this time they cover the subject of Peter's new book, 'The Worst Is Yet to Come: A Post-Capitalist Survival Guide.'

Peter Fleming is a professor at the University of London and the University of Technology, Sydney. He is the author of several books, including The Mythology of Work (2015) and The Death of Homo Economicus (2017). His writing has appeared in the Guardian and Financial Times.

Peter stayed up late in Australia in order to have a lively discussion with your delightful host, and we're greatly appreciative of him.

You should buy Peter's book, and you can do so here: https://repeaterbooks.com/product/the-worst-is-yet-to-come-a-post-capitalist-survival-guide/

item.title: Reports from TERF Island feat. Edie Miller
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
In this week's bonus episode, Nate interviews writer and extreme Trashfuture Tolerator Edie Miller (@multiplebears) about her recent article in the Outline, in which she asks a crucial question: why is UK media so transphobic? Their discussion covers the strangeness of the TERF argument, the weird way in which it has more currency among liberals in the UK than in the US, and much more.

You can read Edie's article here: https://theoutline.com/post/6536/british-feminists-media-transphobic?zd=1&zi=utvxehpk

Also, make sure you buy a t-shirt from Lil' Comrade: https://www.lilcomrade.com/

item.title: Why to Care About Politics feat. Aidan 'Taco' Jones
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
So, this episode was a long time coming. Riley, Milo, and Aidan 'Taco' Jones recorded this during Edinburgh Fringe, but it's been on the back-burner for a while. Now that we're in the beloved dead space between Christmas and the New Year, we saw fit to release it. Regale yourself with a conversation in which Riley explains why you should care about politics.

If you're blessed with holidays from work, hope they're good. And if not, well, neither does our producer.

item.title: #WeHaveBeenPubliclyShamed / Trashfuture Q&A
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
This week's bonus is the first installment of something we've been wanting to do for a while: a Q&A episode. However, before we could get there, we had to read our beloved boy Toby Young's insane holiday column about his 'vertiginous' 'defenestration' from public life.

We did our best to answer your questions with a minimum of Yu Gi Oh references. Well, a relative minimum.

You can commodify your dissent with a t-shirt from http://www.lilcomrade.com/, and what’s more, it’s mandatory if you want to be taken seriously.

item.title: Riley's Festive Commie Book Club: 'The End of the Transition Paradigm'
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
For this week's particularly festive bonus, Riley reviews the academic paper 'The End of the Transition Paradigm' by Thomas Carothers. Riley discusses international relations as a discipline, his takes on some core assumptions of the genre, how it's influenced modern politics in the general Atlantic region, and much more.

You can read the article in its entirety here: https://www.journalofdemocracy.org/sites/default/files/Carothers-13-1.pdf and then tell Riley why, actually, he's wrong.

item.title: Trashfuture Presents: Balthasar Speedboat
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
This week's bonus episode of Trashfuture is actually a pilot of sorts -- it's a comedy show we've assembled featuring an ensemble cast of Milo, Riley, Olga Koch (@rocknrolga), Pierre Novellie ( @pierrenovellie), Alex Kealy (@alexkealy), and a few bits from Nate as well.

It's a show about how to feel the snow in a sensual way, assigned names for criminals, Dilbert-esque porn banter, Adam Sandler's comedic oeuvre, and Nate discussing a repressed memory about a German magazine he read as a kid that depicted a very silly dog.

If you enjoy this, please let us know! We're on the fence about whether or not to do another one... which makes you our partners in podcasting.

item.title: Identity Politics for Landords
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
On this week's bonus, Riley, Milo, Hussein, and Nate discuss Steve Bannon's recent profile in the Guardian, an insane protest letter written by British landlords in opposition to the anti-homelessness nonprofit Shelter, and a terrible startup that wants to despatch fleets of pizza vans that cook your pizza on the go (badly, of course).

Don’t forget that you can commodify your dissent with a t-shirt from http://www.lilcomrade.com/. Get whichever slogan you want, but get the damn shirts!

item.title: Picasso's 'Boss Baby Spice' feat. Elise Bell
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
On this week's bonus, Riley, Milo, Hussein, and Nate speak with art historian Elise Bell (@eliseybell) about her Tabloid Art History ( @TabloidArtHist ) account and why it takes serious effort to stop any creative work from getting commodified (a think we at Trashfuture know too well)...

We had a blast recording this and hope that you enjoy it, too.

*COMEDY KLAXON* Come see Milo host a night of free stand-up at the Sekforde in London on 21st November at 8 pm: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/smoke-comedy-featuring-pierre-novellie-tickets-52410874336

Speaking of commodification, make sure to commodify your dissent with a t-shirt from http://www.lilcomrade.com/.

item.title: Charles and the Bed-Van feat. Ned Donovan
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: Elon Musk gifted us analytics like Prometheus gifting fire, and as such we've determined that about 40 percent of our audience is American. So, Americans (and others) -- do you want to know about the British royal family? Well, now you can, in detail, as Riley, Milo, Hussein, and Ned Donovan (@Ned_Donovan) discuss the history of Britain's terrible ruling family. This is a good episode to listen to while your valet is relocating your bed to your friends' house.

item.title: Trashfuture Live in London, 30th October 2018
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: This is a recording of our recent live show at the Sekforde in London. Thank you so much to the fans who attended — we were stunned by the response and incredibly grateful for your support. When we get Hussein back from the frozen waste of Upstate New York (early next year), we'll put on another show. Special thanks to Woke George Eaton for clarifying some details about how you get an author picture at a media publication.

item.title: Idiocracy Was a Damn Documentary! feat. Adam Rensch
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
This is of course something of a new content type: on this week's bonus episode, Riley, Milo, Nate, and Olga (@rocknrolga) join Adam Rensch (@nachdermas) — host of the Stop/Rewind podcast — to discuss a film that burrowed itself into the American liberal worldview like a hideous, parasitical worm. That film? Idiocracy, the 2006 Mike Judge comedy that frankly sucks, but more on an ethical level than you might expect. Have you ever wanted to do Death of the Author on a shitty movie? You'd better have!

You can check out Adam's podcast here: https://itunes.apple.com/us/podcast/stop-rewind/id1434852449

Also, don't forget that our live show at the Sekforde in London is coming up very soon! Purchase tickets here: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/trashfuture-live-halloween-spooktacular-tickets-51361920888

item.title: Riley's Commie Book Club - For a Left Populism
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: This week's bonus is Riley's Commie Book Club, reviewing Chantal Mouffe's "For a Left Populism. Why are we constantly told that the status quo — i.e. neoliberal market economics  — is the natural order? Why does the centre hate socialism more than fascism? Why is it a bad thing that socialism might leave the absolute wealthiest on the planet worse off than they are in our current gilded age? And why do they want to live in orbiting space stations? Listen to this episode to answer all these questions, and more.

item.title: 2018 Party Conference Special feat. Simon Childs
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
We've just completed party conference season, and to wrap up the important events in all of them (or at least the ones we care about), the Trash lads brought on Simon Childs (@simonchilds13), home affairs editor for Vice UK. You'll get to hear all about the Tory party conference (and its app malfunction), the UKIP conference in which Full Sharia was proposed and -- of course -- this year's Labour conference.

Buy a damn shirt from Lil' Comrade and commodify your dissent: https://www.lilcomrade.com

item.title: He Should Chris Less-lie feat. Jack Frayne-Reid
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary: On this week's bonus episode, we're joined by Jack Frayne-Reid (@frayne_jack) from the Reel Politik Podcast to discuss Chris Leslie's recent sad letter to the Guardian. We cover Labour's lack of broad-churchiness and there variety of ways in which the Blairite faction has become politically irrelevant (save for the pages of every stupid newspaper in Britain).

item.title: EDM: Sonic Gentrification feat. Aloiso Wilmoth
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
Welcome to this week's bonus episode from Riley. You've been promised this for ages and now you're getting it: a discussion on techno as praxis. But, it's not as lame as that might sound, because Riley speaks with musician and producer Aloiso Wilmoth ( @HE_VALENCIA) about the history of techno, its DIY ethos, its Midwest American roots, and how's it's been repackaged and sold as EDM.

You can find Aloiso's music on SoundCloud here: https://soundcloud.com/he_valencian

There's a little bit of warble on the recording! We've done our best to clean it up as much as possible, but you may still notice it periodically.

item.title: The New "You're-A-Pee-in'" feat. Matt Zarb-Cousin
item.itunes:author: TrashFuture
item.itunes:summary:
On this week's bonus episode, Riley, Milo, and Nate sit down with former Jeremy Corbyn spokesman and extremely cool friend of the show Matt Zarb-Cousin (@mattzarb) to discuss the New European, 'a magazine for the 48 per cent.' As you might not be surprised to discover, it's actually the slightly more genteel version of those people with bitmoji avatars and 13 different hashtags in their name who always, always reply to Brexit tweets.

Make sure to listen to the end for some excellent, excellent singing on the part of the lads, who learned from this episode to drink a lot less when recording.

Thank you so much for your support of our show! We're really excited about all the new premium content that we're planning to bring out, and we couldn't do this without you.
